ifpinentrydialog.name: ifPinEntryDialog

methods.name: AddButton

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the button to be added to the pin entry dialog.

params.name: title
params.description: The text to be displayed on the button.

methods.description: Adds a button to the pin entry dialog, with the specified title displayed on the button. The buttons are aligned at the bottom of the screen and appear in the order added. When a button is pressed, the script will receive an [roPinEntryDialogEvent](https://developer.roku.com/docs/references/brightscript/events/ropinentrydialogevent.md"roPinEntryDialogEvent") from the application indicating the ID of the button pressed.

methods.name: Pin
methods.description: Gets the user-entered PIN.
methods.returnDescription: A string containing the PIN entered by the user.

methods.name: SetNumPinEntryFields

params.name: numFields
params.description: The maximum number of digits for the PIN.

methods.description: Sets the maximum number of digits to be entered and displayed for the PIN.

methods.name: Show
methods.description: Displays or refreshes the screen after creation or state changes.

methods.name: SetTitle

params.name: title
params.description: The text to be displayed on the pin entry dialog.

methods.description: Sets the title for the pin entry dialog to the specified string.

methods.name: EnableBackButton

params.name: enableBackButton
params.description: Enables [isScreenClosed()](https://developer.roku.com/docs/references/brightscript/events/ropinentrydialogevent.mdisscreenclosed-as-boolean) events to be sent when the back button is entered.

methods.description: Enables the channel to receive an [isScreenClosed()](https://developer.roku.com/docs/references/brightscript/events/ropinentrydialogevent.mdisscreenclosed-as-boolean) event when the back button is entered. By default the [PinEntryDialog](https://developer.roku.com/docs/references/brightscript/components/ropinentrydialog.md component will not send an [isScreenClosed()](https://developer.roku.com/docs/references/brightscript/events/ropinentrydialogevent.mdisscreenclosed-as-boolean) event so that scripts that did not expect this event will not break

implementers.name: roPinEntryDialog
implementers.description: The Pin Entry Dialog is designed to allow the user to enter a numeric PIN for purchasing content

ifposterscreen.name: ifPosterScreen

methods.name: SetTitle

params.name: title
params.description: The text to be used as the title for the poster screen.

methods.description: Sets the title for the poster screen.

methods.name: SetContentList

params.name: contentList
params.description: An [roArray](https://developer.roku.com/docs/references/brightscript/components/roarray.md"roArray") of [roAssociativeArrays](https://developer.roku.com/docs/references/brightscript/components/roassociativearray.md"roAssociativeArrays") ([Content Meta-Data](/docs/developer-program/getting-started/architecture/content-metadata.md " Content Meta-Data") objects) representing the information for each title to be displayed on screen.

methods.description: Sets the list of content to be displayed by the screen. The screen is responsible for fetching the poster art from the URLs specified and all user navigation within the list.

methods.name: GetContentList
methods.description: Gets the content metadata of each title displayed on the screen. This is the content metadata passed via the [SetContentList()](#setcontentlistcontentlist-as-object-as-void) method.
methods.returnDescription: An [roArray](/docs/references/brightscript/components/roarray.md "roArray") containing content metadata.

methods.name: SetListNames

params.name: names
params.description: An array of Strings, where each String represents a new category to be displayed at the top. The display order is the same as the order of the categories in the array passed by the caller

methods.description: Sets the list of categories to be displayed in the filter banner at the top of the poster screen.

methods.name: SetListStyle
methods.description: Sets the display style for the poster screen. Styles allow the poster screen to look differently for different types of content or different usage.

methods.name: SetListDisplayMode

params.name: displayMode
params.description: Specifies the mode used to display images on the poster screen, which may be one of the following values:  *   scale-to-fill – scale image to completely fill the rectangle of the bounding frame (Default) *   scale-to-fit – scale image to fit horizontally or vertically as appropriate while still maintaining aspect ratio. Note that scale-to-fit may result in pillar-box or letter-box display of images. *   zoom-to-fill – scales and crops image to maintain aspect ratio and completely fill the rectangle of the bounding frame. *   photo-fit – Uses several methods to fit the image with a different aspect ratio to the screen. First, it will asymmetrically scale up to a maximum of 5%. Second, for landscape images, if vertical cropping is necessary, it will remove two lines off the bottom for every one line off the top up to a maximum of 30% of the image. For all images, if horizontal cropping is necessary it will crop an equal amount from both sides.

methods.description: Sets the mode for displaying images in the poster screen. This allows images to be either scaled to completely fill the poster frame (scale-to-fill) or scaled to fit inside the poster frame (scale-to-fit) while maintaining aspect ratio

methods.name: SetFocusedList

params.name: itemIndex
params.description: The zero-based index of the item to obtain focus.

methods.description: The item the in filter banner to be given focus. The selected item is displayed in the center of the filter banner, and it is highlighted to denote that it has focus.

params.name: itemIndex
params.description: The zero-based index of the item to obtain focus.

methods.name: SetBreadcrumbText

params.name: location1
params.description: The text to be used for the first location.

params.name: location2
params.description: The text to be used for the second location.

methods.description: Specifies the text to be displayed for the title in breadcrumb format.

methods.name: SetBreadcrumbEnabled

params.name: enable
params.description: A flag specifying whether the breadcrumb text is to be displayed on the poster screen.

methods.description: Shows or hides the breadcrumb text in the title area.

methods.name: ShowMessage

params.name: message
params.description: The text to be displayed in the popup message box.

methods.description: Displays a semi-transparent popup message box to the user in the center of the screen over the poster screen. Generally, this is used for error messages.

methods.name: ClearMessage
methods.description: Clears the message from the previous [ShowMessage()](https://developer.roku.com/docs/references/brightscript/interfaces/ifposterscreen.mdshowmessagemessage-as-string-as-void) method call.

methods.name: SetAdURL

params.name: sdAdURL
params.description: The URL of the standard definition banner ad image (540x60) to be displayed.

params.name: hdAdURL
params.description: The URL of the high definition banner ad image (728x90) to be displayed.

methods.description: Sets the URL of the banner ad image to be displayed on the poster screen. This is currently only valid for the "arced-landscape" and "flat-category" style of poster screens.

methods.name: SetAdSelectable

params.name: isSelectable
params.description: A flag specifying if the user can navigate and move focus to the banner image (true) or if the banner ad is not selectable (false).

methods.description: Enables the banner ad to be selectable. When selected, the screen will receive an [roPosterScreenEvent](https://developer.roku.com/docs/references/brightscript/events/roposterscreenevent.md and the msg will return true for [isAdSelected()](https://developer.roku.com/docs/references/brightscript/events/roposterscreenevent.mdisadselected-as-boolean).

methods.name: SetAdDisplayMode
methods.description: Sets the scale mode for displaying ad images on the poster screen. The ad display is only available on "arced-landscape" and "flat-category" list styles.

methods.name: SetLoadingPoster
methods.description: Specifies the default images to be shown in the poster screen while the poster screen content is loading

methods.name: Show
methods.description: Displays or refreshes the screen after initial creation or state changes.
methods.returnDescription: A boolean indicating whether the screen was successfully displayed.

methods.name: SetFocusToFilterBanner

params.name: enable
params.description: A flag specifying whether the filter banner is to obtain focus.

methods.description: Sets the focus to the filter banner.

methods.name: GetChannels

params.name: id
params.description: The program ID containing the channels to be returned.

methods.description: Returns the list of logical channel numbers on which the given program ID can be found.

params.name: channel

methods.description: Returns details about the current and next program on a channel.
methods.returnDescription: An roAssociativeArray containing two roArray components: one for the current program and another for the next program on the channel. Each roArray contains the following key/value pairs detailing the program:

methods.name: GetVersion

ifregex.name: ifRegex

methods.name: IsMatch

params.name: str
params.description: The string to be checked.

methods.description: Checks if a string matches the matching pattern.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the string matches the matching pattern.

methods.name: Match

params.name: str
params.description: The string to be searched for matching substrings.

methods.description: If the matching pattern contains N parenthetical substrings, the relevant substrings are returned as an array of length N+1, where array\[0\] is again the entire match and each additional entry in the array is the match for the corresponding parenthetical expression.
methods.returnDescription: An roArray of matched substrings from str. If no match was made, an empty array is returned. If a match was made, the entire match is returned in array\[0\]. If there are no parenthetical substrings this is the only entry in the array

methods.name: MatchAll

params.name: str
params.description: The string to be searched for matching substrings.

methods.description: Returns all matches of the specific regular expression pattern in the target string.
methods.returnDescription: An roArray where the first element is the full matched string and if there are any capture groups those are returned in subsequent array elements

methods.name: Replace

params.name: str
params.description: The string to be searched.

params.name: replacement
params.description: The string to be used to replace matches in source string.

methods.description: Replaces the first occurrence of a matching pattern in str with replacement and returns the result. The replacement may contain numbered back-references to parenthetical substrings.
methods.returnDescription: A string with the result of the replace operation.

methods.name: ReplaceAll

params.name: str
params.description: The string to be searched.

params.name: replacement
params.description: The string to be used to replace matches in source string.

methods.description: Replaces all occurrences of a matching pattern in str with replacement and returns the result. The replacement may contain numbered back-references to parenthetical substrings.
methods.returnDescription: A string with the result of the replace all operation.

methods.name: Split

params.name: str
params.description: The string to be split.

methods.description: Uses the matching pattern as a separator and splits the string on the separator boundaries.
methods.returnDescription: An roList of substrings of str that were separated by strings which match the pattern in the CreateObject call. The separator strings are not returned. If no matches were found, the returned list contains a single item with the string unchanged.

implementers.name: roRegex
implementers.description: The roRegex component provides the powerful regular expression processing of the PCRE library to Brightscript strings

ifregex.description: > See the PCRE documentation ([http://www.pcre.org/](http://www.pcre.org/)) for documentation on the PCRE library used for regular expression matching. See the [Perlre main page](http://perldoc.perl.org/perlre.html "Perlre main page") for complete documentation of the possible regular expressions this library can parse and match. In general, most Perl compatible regular expressions are supported.

methods.name: GetBitmap
methods.description: Returns the roBitmap object of the bitmap to which this region refers. A region is always a section of a bitmap.
methods.returnDescription: An roBitmap object of the bitmap.

methods.name: GetX
methods.description: Returns the x coordinate of the region in its bitmap.
methods.returnDescription: The x coordinate value

methods.name: GetY
methods.description: Returns the y coordinate of the region in its bitmap.
methods.returnDescription: The y coordinate value

methods.name: GetWidth
methods.description: Returns the width of the region.
methods.returnDescription: The width of the region.

methods.name: GetHeight
methods.description: Returns the height of the region.
methods.returnDescription: The height of the region.

methods.name: Offset

params.name: x
params.description: The x-coordinate of the region.

params.name: y
params.description: The y-coordinate of the region.

params.name: w
params.description: The width of the region.

params.name: h
params.description: The height of the region.

methods.description: Adds the passed parameters x,y, w, and h to the values of those roRegion fields. Respects the wrap setting when adjusting the fields by the offsets.

methods.name: Set

params.name: srcRegion
params.description: An roRegion object.

methods.description: Initializes the fields of this region to be the same as the values of the fields in the srcRegion.

methods.name: Copy
methods.description: Returns a newly created copy of the region as a new [roRegion](https://developer.roku.com/docs/references/brightscript/components/roregion.md"roRegion") object.
methods.returnDescription: An roRegion Object.

methods.name: SetWrap

params.name: wrap
params.description: A flag specifying whether wrapping of the region is enabled. If this flag is set to false, the part of the region beyond the bounds of its bitmap is not rendered.

methods.description: Wraps any part of a region that extends beyond the bounds of its bitmap to the other side of the bitmap and renders it there.

methods.name: GetWrap
methods.description: Returns if the region can be wrapped.

methods.name: SetTime

params.name: time
params.description: The "frame hold time" in milliseconds.

methods.description: Sets the duration of each frame of any animated sprite that uses this region.

methods.name: SetPretranslation

params.name: x
params.description: The pre-translation x-value.

params.name: y
params.description: The pre-translation y-value.

methods.description: Sets the pre-translation for DrawObject, DrawRotatedObject, and DrawScaledObject.

methods.name: GetPretranslationX
methods.description: Returns the pre-translation x value.
methods.returnDescription: The pre-translation x value.

methods.name: GetPretranslationY
methods.description: Returns the pre-translation y value.
methods.returnDescription: The pre-translation y value.

methods.name: SetScaleMode

params.name: mode
params.description: The scaling mode, which may be one of the following values:  *   0 = fast scaling operation (may have jaggies) *   1 = smooth scaling operation (may be slow)

methods.description: Sets the scaling mode used for DrawScaledObject.

methods.name: GetScaleMode
methods.description: Returns the scaling mode.
methods.returnDescription: The scaling mode, which may be one of the following values:

methods.name: SetCollisionType

params.name: collisiontype
params.description: The collision type, which may be one of the following values:  *   Type 0– Use the entire defined region of the sprite. Type 0 is the default *   Type 1 – Use the defined rectangular region specified by the SetCollisionRectangle() method *   Type 2 – Use a circular region specified by the SetCollisionCircle() method

methods.description: Sets the type of region to be used for collision tests with this sprite.

methods.name: GetCollisionType
methods.description: Returns the collision type.
methods.returnDescription: The collision type, which may be one of the following values:

methods.name: SetCollisionRectangle

params.name: xOffset
params.description: The offset for the x position of the sprite.

params.name: yOffset
params.description: The offset for the y position of the sprite.

params.name: width
params.description: The width of the rectangle.

params.name: height
params.description: The height of the rectangle.

methods.description: Sets the collision rectangle used for type-1 collision tests. The upper left corner of the rectangle is the (x,y) position of the sprite plus the specified offsets. The width and height specify the size of the rectangle.

methods.name: SetCollisionCircle

params.name: xOffset
params.description: The offset for the x position of the sprite.

params.name: yOffset
params.description: The offset for the y position of the sprite.

params.name: Radius
params.description: The size of the circle.

methods.description: Sets the collision circle used for type-2 collision tests. The center of the circle is the (x,y) position of the sprite plus the specified offsets. The radius specifies the size of the circle.

implementers.name: roRegion
implementers.description: The roRegion component is used to represent a subsection of a bitmap

methods.name: GetSpaceAvailable
methods.description: Returns the number of bytes available in the channel application's device registry (16K minus current file size). This function can be used, for example, to check the remaining space and remove older entries before writing newer ones. The following code demonstrates how to do this:
methods.returnDescription: An integer representing the the number of bytes available in the device registry.

methods.name: GetSectionList
methods.description: Returns the registry sections on the device.
methods.returnDescription: An roList with one entry for each registry section. Each registry section is an roString containing the name of the section. The section itself can be accessed by creating an [roRegistrySection](/docs/references/brightscript/components/roregistrysection.md "roRegistrySection") object using that name.

methods.name: Delete

params.name: section
params.description: The registry section to be deleted.

methods.description: Deletes the specified registry section.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the registry section was successfully deleted.

methods.name: Flush
methods.description: Flushes the contents of the registry out to persistent storage in order to permanently store a token or other setting on the device.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the registry was successfully flushed.

implementers.name: roRegistry
implementers.description: The Registry is an area of non-volatile storage where a small number of persistent settings can be stored

methods.name: Read

params.name: key
params.description: The key name to be read.

methods.description: Reads and returns the value of the specified key.
methods.returnDescription: The value of the key.

methods.name: ReadMulti

params.name: keysArray
params.description: An array of strings containing the key names to be read.

methods.description: Reads multiple values from the registry.
methods.returnDescription: An associative array containing the keys and corresponding values read from the registry.

methods.name: Write

params.name: key
params.description: The name of the key to be updated.

params.name: value
params.description: The updated value to be written to the specified key.

methods.description: Replaces the value of the specified key. Does not guarantee a commit to non-volatile storage until an explicit [Flush()](#flush-as-boolean) is done.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the value of the key was successfully updated.

methods.name: WriteMulti

params.name: roAssociativeArray
params.description: An associative array with key-value pairs to be updated.

methods.description: Writes multiple values to the registry.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the values were successfully updated.

methods.name: Delete

params.name: key
params.description: The key to be deleted.

methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the key was successfully deleted.

methods.name: Exists

params.name: key
params.description: The key to be checked.

methods.description: Checks if the specified key resides in the registry.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the key is in the registry.

methods.name: Flush
methods.description: Flushes the contents of the registry out to persistent storage in order to permanently store a token or other setting on the device. Developers should explicitly this method after performing a write or series of writes. This method is transactional and all writes between calls to it are atomic.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the registry was successfully flushed.

methods.name: GetKeyList
methods.description: Gets a list of the keys in the registry.
methods.returnDescription: An roList containing one entry per registry key in this section.

implementers.name: roRegistrySection
implementers.description: A Registry Section enables the organization of settings within the registry

methods.name: SetPrivateKey

params.name: keyFileName
params.description: Specifies the private key to be used for signing. The file name should specify a path, either in the package or a temp path.

methods.description: Specifies the private key to use for signing.

params.name: keyFileName
params.description: Specifies the public key to be used for signing. The file name should specify a path, either in the package or a temp path.

methods.name: SetDigestAlgorithm

params.name: digestAlgorithm
params.description: An openssl string with the digest to be used. Common digest algorithms are "sha1", "ripemd160", and "md5".

methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the algorithm was successfully set (true) or the string was not recognized (false).

methods.name: Sign

params.name: digest
params.description: The roByteArray to be signed. Errors will be printed in the BrightScript console. If the digest algorithm is not set (using SetDigestAlgorithm) before calling Sign(), the digest is not encapsulated. This would be equivalent to simply calling the openssl function RSA\_private\_encrypt()

methods.description: Generates a signature based on the specified digest.
methods.returnDescription: An roByteArray containing the signature, or invalid if an error occurred. Typical values include the following:

methods.name: Verify

params.name: digest
params.description: The digest to be verified.

params.name: signature
params.description: The signature to be verified.

methods.description: Verifies the given digest and signature. Both digest and signature should be roByteArrays. If the digest algorithm is not set (using the [SetDigestAlgorithm](#setdigestalgorithmdigestalgorithm-as-string-as-boolean) method) before calling Verify(), the digest associated with the signature is not expected to be encapsulated. This would be equivalent to simply calling the openssl function RSA\_public\_decrypt(signature) and then comparing the result with the digest
methods.returnDescription: Indicates the result of the validation. This may be one of the following values:

implementers.name: roRSA
implementers.description: The RSA component provides an interface to the OpenSSL RSA library of signing algorithms

methods.name: SetMessagePort

ifsgnodeboundingrect.name: ifSGNodeBoundingRect

methods.name: boundingRect
methods.description: Returns the node bounding rectangle. The bounding rectangle of a node is the axis-aligned rectangle computed by transforming the local bounding rectangle of the node by the node transformation matrix. The resulting rectangle corresponds to the node local bounding rectangle transformed into its parent node local coordinate system.
methods.returnDescription: An associative array with the node bounding rectangle.

methods.name: localBoundingRect
methods.description: Returns the node local bounding rectangle. The local bounding rectangle of a node is the axis-aligned rectangle, that includes the union of the bounding rectangle of the geometry of the node, and the bounding rectangles of all of the node children, transformed into the local coordinate system of the node.
methods.returnDescription: An associative array with the node local bounding rectangle.

methods.name: sceneBoundingRect
methods.description: Returns the bounding rectangle for scene components (component nodes extended from a [Scene](https://developer.roku.com/docs/references/scenegraph/scene.md"Scene") or [OverhangPanelSetScene](https://developer.roku.com/docs/references/scenegraph/sliding-panels-nodes/overhangpanelsetscene.md"OverhangPanelSetScene") node class).
methods.returnDescription: An associative array with the bounding rectangle.

methods.name: localSubBoundingRect

params.name: itemnumber
params.description: The index of the grid item for the local bounding rectangle to be returned in the following format: _rowindex_\__itemindex_.

methods.description: Returns the local bounding rectangle of this node's identified sub part in the node's local coordinate system. If the subpart does not exist, the node's local bounding rectangle is returned.
methods.returnDescription: An associative array with the local bounding rectangle of the node's identified sub part.

methods.name: subBoundingRect

params.name: itemnumber
params.description: The index of the grid item for the local bounding rectangle to be returned in the following format: _rowindex_\__itemindex_.

methods.description: Returns the bounding rectangle of this node's identified sub part, as transformed by this node's transformation matrix, in its parent node's coordinate system. If the subpart does not exist, the node's bounding rectangle is returned.
methods.returnDescription: An associative array with the bounding rectangle.

methods.name: sceneSubBoundingRect

params.name: itemnumber
params.description: The index of the grid item for the bounding rectangle to be returned in the following format: _rowindex_\__itemindex_.

methods.description: Returns the bounding rectangle of this node's subpart in its Scene's coordinate system If the subpart does not exist or if the node is not an ancestor of a Scene node, this will return the node's bounding rectangle.
methods.returnDescription: An associative array with the bounding rectangle.

implementers.name: roSGNode
implementers.description: The roSGNode object is the BrightScript equivalent of SceneGraph XML file node creation

ifsgnodeboundingrect.description:
The ifSGNodeBoundingRect interface can be used to query the bounding rectangle of subject node. The ifSGNodeBoundingRect interface methods return a node bounding rectangle as an associative array with four elements:

| Name | Value |
| --- | --- |
| x | x-coordinate of the origin of the bounding rectangle |
| y | y-coordinate of the origin of the bounding rectangle |
| width | width of the bounding rectangle |
| height | height of the bounding rectangle |

> These methods return the bounding rectangle dimensions and location of component objects at the time they are called. If they are called before an object is fully constructed, such as before all graphical images have been loaded, they will return the dimensions and location at the time of the call, which may not be the correct values for placing the component object properly. To ensure that your screen has the component objects located as you intended, make sure you call these methods after the component object is fully constructed. For example, if the component object relies on loading graphical images to construct its appearance, it is best to use these methods as part of an observer callback function triggered by the image loading field events, such as the loadStatus field of the Poster node.

ifsgnodechildren.name: ifSGNodeChildren

methods.name: createChild

params.name: nodeType
params.description: The node class to be created.

methods.description: Creates a child node of type nodeType, and adds the new node to the end of the subject node list of children.
methods.returnDescription: The child node that was created.

methods.name: removeChildIndex

params.name: index
params.description: The position in the tree of the child node to be removed.

methods.description: If the subject node has a child node in the index position, removes that child node from the subject node list of children.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the child node that was successfully removed.

methods.name: getChild

params.name: index
params.description: The index of the child node to be retrieved.

methods.description: Returns the child node specified by the index.
methods.returnDescription: The child node at the index position; otherwise, "invalid".

methods.name: getParent
methods.description: Returns the parent node of a node has been added to a list of children.
methods.returnDescription: The parent node; otherwise, "invalid".

methods.name: getChildCount
methods.description: Returns the current number of children in the subject node list of children. This is always a non-negative number.
methods.returnDescription: The number of child nodes in the tree.

methods.name: appendChildren
methods.description: Appends an array of children nodes to the subject node.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the children nodes were successfully appended.

methods.name: insertChildren
methods.description: Inserts an array of child nodes to the subject node, starting at a specific position.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the children nodes were successfully inserted.

methods.name: removeChildren
methods.description: Removes an array of child nodes from the subject node.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the children nodes were successfully removed.

methods.name: removeChildrenIndex
methods.description: Removes a specific number of child nodes from the subject node starting at a specific position.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the children nodes were successfully removed.

methods.name: replaceChildren
methods.description: Replaces the child nodes in the subject node, starting at the position specified by index, with new child nodes specified by child\_nodes
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the children nodes were successfully replaced.

methods.name: getChildren
methods.description: Retrieves a specific number of child nodes from the subject node, starting at a specific position.
methods.returnDescription: An roArray containing the child nodes retrieved. If num\_children is -1, all the child nodes are returned.

methods.name: createChildren
methods.description: Creates a specific number of new child nodes of a specific type or extended type.
methods.returnDescription: An roArray containing the new child nodes created.

methods.name: getScene
methods.description: Returns the node's root Scene. This returns a valid Scene even if the node is not parented.
methods.returnDescription: The node's root Scene.

methods.name: getAll
methods.description: Returns an array with every existing node created by the currently running channel.
methods.returnDescription: An roArray with the all the existing nodes created by the channel.

methods.name: getRoots
methods.description: Returns an array with every existing node without a parent created by the currently running channel.

methods.name: getRootsMeta
methods.description: Returns an array with every existing node without a parent created by the currently running channel.
methods.returnDescription: An roArray with every existing node without a parent created by the currently running channel.

methods.name: getAllMeta
methods.description: Returns an array with every existing node created by the currently running channel (similar to the [getAll()](#getall-as-object) method) organized as an XML forest of trees according to the usual parent-child node relationship. Cycles are handled with a reference entry in the tree rather than indefinite recursion.
methods.returnDescription: An roArray of strings with the all the existing nodes created by the channel.

ifsgnodedict.name: ifSGNodeDict

methods.name: findNode

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the node to be retrieved.

methods.description: Returns the node that is a descendant of the nearest component ancestor of the subject node (possibly the subject node itself) and whose id field is set to name. The search for the descendant node is a breadth-first search that includes child nodes in nodes that are declared as custom components defined in other XML component files. These together allow finding siblings and cousins of a node within the context of a component. If a node with the specified name is not found, an invalid object is returned
methods.returnDescription: The node that is a descendant of the nearest component ancestor of the subject node.

methods.name: subtype
methods.description: Returns the subtype of the subject node as specified when it was created.
methods.returnDescription: The subtype of the subject node.

methods.name: parentSubtype

params.name: nodeType
params.description: The node type of the parent node.

methods.description: Returns the subtype of the parent of the nodeType in the SceneGraph node class hierarchy.
methods.returnDescription: The subtype of the parent node.

methods.name: isSubtype

params.name: nodeType
params.description: The node type of the subject node.

methods.description: Checks whether the subtype of the subject node is a descendant of the subtype nodeType in the SceneGraph node class hierarchy.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the subtype of the subject node is a descendant of the subtype nodeType.

methods.name: isSameNode
methods.description: Checks whether a specific roSGNode refers to the same SceneGraph node object as the subject node.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the nodes refer to the same SceneGraph node object.

methods.name: clone
methods.returnDescription: A node tree.

ifsgnodefield.name: ifSGNodeField

methods.name: setField

params.name: fieldName
params.description: The name of the field to be updated.

params.name: value
params.description: The updated value for the field.

methods.description: Sets the value of a subject node field. This will fail and stop script execution if the value is not of the appropriate type.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the field was successfully updated.

methods.name: observeField

params.name: fieldName
params.description: The name of the field to be monitored.

params.name: functionName
params.description: The name of the method to be executed when the value of the field changes.

methods.description: Calls a function when a field of the subject node changes. The function called must be in the scope of the current component.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the value of the field being monitored changes.

methods.name: observeField

params.name: fieldName
params.description: The name of the field to be monitored.

params.name: port
params.description: The [roMessagePort](https://developer.roku.com/docs/references/brightscript/components/romessageport.md"roMessagePort") to receive a [roSGNodeEvent](https://developer.roku.com/docs/references/brightscript/components/rosgnode.md"roSGNodeEvent") message when the value of the field changes.

methods.description: This overloaded form sends an [roSGNodeEvent](https://developer.roku.com/docs/references/brightscript/components/rosgnode.md"roSGNodeEvent") message to the [roMessagePort](https://developer.roku.com/docs/references/brightscript/components/romessageport.md"roMessagePort") identified by port when the subject node field identified by fieldName changes value.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the value of the field being monitored changes.

methods.name: queueFields

params.name: queueNode
params.description: A flag enabling queuing on the node.

methods.description: Makes subsequent operations on the node fields to queue on the node itself rather than on the [Scene](https://developer.roku.com/docs/references/scenegraph/scene.md"Scene") node render thread. This prevents the operations from being executed immediately.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating the current state of **queueNode**.

methods.name: addFields

params.name: fields
params.description: An roAssociativeArray containing key-value pairs for the fields to be added.

methods.description: Adds the field(s) and corresponding field value(s) defined as key-value pair(s) in the associative array fields to the subject node. The types of the added fields are determined by the values which correspond to the allowable types for an `<interface>` field.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the fields have been successfully added.

methods.name: getField

params.name: fieldName

params.name: type
params.description: The type of the field to be added.      Type declarations must be lowercase or the field will not be added to the node. For example, declaring "Boolean" as the type will prevent the field from being added.

params.name: alwayNotify
params.description: Specifies whether observers of the field are triggered when the field value is updated to the same or new value (true), or only when the field changes to a new value (false).

methods.description: Adds a field with the specified name and type to the subject node. The added field is initialized to the default value for the type.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the field have been successfully added.

Fields defined in [content metadata](/docs/developer-program/getting-started/architecture/content-metadata.md " Content Meta-Data") and the related SceneGraph node class metadata bindings can be removed, but will be dynamically re-added at any time they are explicitly accessed.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the field has been successfully removed.

params.name: fieldName

methods.description: Sets up a connection between the observed node's field and the current component from which this call is made. This method is similar to the [observeField()](https://developer.roku.com/docs/references/brightscript/interfaces/ifsgnodefield.mdobservefieldfieldname-as-string-functionname-as-string-as-boolean "observeField(fieldName as String, functionName as String)") method.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the value of the field has changed.

params.name: fieldName

params.name: port

This method is similar to the [observeField()](https://developer.roku.com/docs/references/brightscript/interfaces/ifsgnodefield.mdobservefieldfieldname-as-string-functionname-as-string-as-boolean "observeField(fieldName as String, functionName as String)") method.

False = Removes focus from the subject node if it had it. Setting the remote control focus to false is rarely necessary, and can lead to unexpected behavior.

ifslideshow.name: ifSlideshow

methods.name: SetContentList

params.name: contentList
params.description: An [roArray](https://developer.roku.com/docs/references/brightscript/components/roarray.md"roArray") of [roAssociativeArrays](https://developer.roku.com/docs/references/brightscript/components/roassociativearray.md"roAssociativeArrays") ([Content Meta-Data](/docs/developer-program/getting-started/architecture/content-metadata.md "Content Meta-Data") objects) representing the information for each title to be displayed on screen

methods.description: Set the content to be played by the slide show.

methods.name: AddContent

params.name: contentItem
params.description: The content metadata item to be added to the slideshow list.

methods.description: Add a new [content metadata](/docs/developer-program/getting-started/architecture/content-metadata.md "Content Meta-Data") item to the end of the content list for the slide show.

methods.name: ClearContent
methods.description: Clears all content from the content list.

methods.name: CountButtons
methods.description: Returns the count of all the buttons added to the slide show screen.
methods.returnDescription: The button count value.

methods.name: SetNext

params.name: item
params.description: The zero-based index of the item in the content list.

params.name: isImmediate
params.description: Forces an immediate update to the slideshow.

methods.description: Makes the SlideShow object queue a specific slide up as the next slide.

methods.name: SetPeriod

params.name: seconds
params.description: The number of seconds that each slide is displayed.

methods.description: Specifies the number of seconds that each slide is displayed.

methods.name: SetTextOverlayHoldTime

params.name: milliseconds
params.description: The number of milliseconds to display the text overlay. If this is set to 0, the overlay is off.

methods.description: Defines the number of milliseconds to display the text overlay for each slide.

methods.name: Pause
methods.description: Puts the slide show into pause mode. Setting the player to pause mode if it is not in play mode generates in error.
methods.returnDescription: A flag that indicates whether the slide show was successfully set to pause mode.

methods.name: Resume
methods.description: Puts the slide show into play mode starting from the pause point. Setting the player to play mode when it is not in pause mode generates in error.
methods.returnDescription: A flag that indicates whether the slide show was successfully set to pause mode.

methods.name: SetTextOverlayIsVisible

params.name: IsVisible
params.description: A flag specifying whether the overlay is displayed.

methods.description: Displays the overlay. This method is OR'd with the overlay hold time; therefore, even if **IsVisible** is false, the overlay is displayed during the slide's overlay hold time.

methods.name: AddButton

params.name: id
params.description: The ID used to uniquely identify the button instance.

params.name: title
params.description: The title used for the button.

methods.description: Adds a button to the screen. The buttons are displayed in a standard location on the screen and appear in the order added. When the button is pressed, the script will receive an event from the application containing the ID of the button pressed
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the button was successfully added.

methods.name: AddRatingButton

params.name: id
params.description: The ID used to uniquely identify the rating button instance.

params.name: rating
params.description: A value between 1-100 that represents the number of stars (1 to 5) to be displayed. Essentially this a percentage value: <20% = 1 star.

methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the rating button was successfully added.

methods.name: SetUnderscan

params.name: percentage
params.description: The percentage to be used to reduce the image size.

methods.description: Set the percentage to reduce the image size by to compensate for monitor overscan (for example, 2.5 for 2.5%).

methods.name: SetDisplayMode

params.name: displayMode
params.description: The display mode, which may be one of the following values:  *   scale-to-fill – scale image to completely fill the rectangle of the bounding frame (Default) *   scale-to-fit – scale image to fit horizontally or vertically as appropriate while still maintaining aspect ratio. Note that scale-to-fit may result in pillar-box or letter-box display of images. *   zoom-to-fill – scales and crops image to maintain aspect ratio and completely fill the rectangle of the bounding frame. *   photo-fit – Uses several methods to fit the image with a different aspect ratio to the screen. First, it will asymmetrically scale up to a maximum of 5%. Second, for landscape images, if vertical cropping is necessary, it will remove two lines off the bottom for every one line off the top up to a maximum of 30% of the image. For all images, if horizontal cropping is necessary it will crop an equal amount from both sides.

methods.description: Sets the mode for displaying slideshow images. This allows images to be either scaled to completely fill the screen (scale-to-fill) or scaled to fit inside the screen (scale-to-fit) while maintaining aspect ratio.

methods.name: SetMaxUpscale

params.name: maxUpscale
params.description: The maximum scale factor to be used.

methods.description: Set the maximum scale factor for scale-to-fill, zoom-to-fill, and photo-fit modes.

methods.name: GetMaxUpscale
methods.description: Retrieves the maximum scale factor.
methods.returnDescription: The scale factor.

methods.name: Show
methods.description: Displays or refreshes the screen after creation or state changes.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the screen was successfully displayed.

methods.name: Close
methods.description: Closes the screens and delete the associated object. This is useful for avoiding screen flicker when the display order of your screens does not resemble a stack

methods.name: SetBorderColor

params.name: color
params.description: The HTML hex color value to be used as the border.

methods.description: Sets the border color used as the background around the slide.

methods.name: SetLoop

params.name: loop
params.description: A flag specifying whether to loop through all the slides.

methods.description: Makes the slideshow loop through all the slides.

implementers.name: roSlideShow
implementers.description: The Slide Show screen provides the ability to setup a photo slide show to playback a series of images

Beginning July 1st, 2017, any new channels using this component will be rejected during certification.

methods.name: Send

params.name: data
params.description: A [roByteArray](https://developer.roku.com/docs/references/brightscript/components/robytearray.md"roByteArray") containing the data to be sent.

params.name: startIndex
params.description: The index of the byte array from which to start sending data.

params.name: length
params.description: The amount of data to be sent to the socket.

methods.description: Sends up to length bytes of data to the socket.
methods.returnDescription: The number of bytes sent.

methods.name: SendStr

params.name: data
params.description: A string containing the data to be sent.

methods.description: Sends the whole string to the socket, if possible.
methods.returnDescription: The number of bytes sent.

methods.name: Receive

params.name: data
params.description: A [roByteArray](https://developer.roku.com/docs/references/brightscript/components/robytearray.md"roByteArray") containing the data to be stored.

params.name: startIndex
params.description: The index of the byte array from which to start reading data.

params.name: length
params.description: The amount of data to be read from the socket.

methods.description: Reads data from the socket.
methods.returnDescription: The number of bytes read.

methods.name: ReceiveStr

params.name: length
params.description: The amount of data to be read from the socket.

methods.returnDescription: The received byte length string. If no bytes are received, the string is empty.

methods.name: SetAddress

params.name: sockAddr
params.description: An roSocketAddress.

methods.description: Sets the address using a BSD bind() call
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the address was successfully set.

methods.name: GetAddress
methods.description: Returns the roSocketAddress object bound to this socket.
methods.returnDescription: roSocketAddress Object.

methods.name: SetSendToAddress

params.name: sockAddr
params.description: An roSocketAddress.

methods.description: Sets the remote address for next message to be sent.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the address was successfully stored as the first half of underlying BSD sendto() call.

methods.name: GetSendToAddress
methods.description: Returns the roSocketAddress for the remote address of the next message to be sent. This method can also be used to return the remote address on newly accepted sockets.
methods.returnDescription: The roSocketAddress for the remote address of the next message to be sent.

methods.name: GetReceivedFromAddress
methods.description: Returns the roSocketAddress for the remote address of the last message received via the [receive()](#receivedata-as-object-startindex-as-integer-length-as-integer-as-integer) method. This method can also be used to return the remote address on newly accepted sockets.
methods.returnDescription: The roSocketAddress for the remote address of the last message received.

methods.name: GetCountRcvBuf
methods.description: Returns the number of bytes in the receive buffer.
methods.returnDescription: Number of bytes.

methods.name: GetCountSendBuf
methods.description: Returns the number of bytes in the send buffer.
methods.returnDescription: Number of bytes.

methods.name: Status
methods.description: Indicates whether the last operation was successful.
methods.returnDescription: This method returns 0 if the last operation was successful or an error number if it failed.

methods.name: SetAddress

params.name: address
params.description: The string consists of a hostname, optionally followed by a colon and a decimal port number. The hostname may be either dotted quad (such as "192.168.1.120") or a DNS name (such as "roku.com"). If a name is given, a DNS lookup is performed to convert it to dotted quad. Use IsAddressValid() to determine the result of the DNS lookup. Example: "192.168.1.120:8888" or "roku.com".

methods.description: Sets the IPV4 address.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the IPV4 address was successfully set.

methods.name: GetAddress
methods.returnDescription: The IPV4 address.

methods.name: SetHostName

params.name: hostname
params.description: The hostname to be used.

methods.description: Sets the hostname. The port number is unchanged.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the hostname was successfully set.

methods.name: GetHostName
methods.description: Returns the hostname.
methods.returnDescription: The hostname.

methods.name: SetPort

params.name: port
params.description: The port number to be used.

methods.description: Sets the port number. The hostname is unchanged.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the port number was successfully set.

methods.name: GetPort
methods.description: Returns the port number.
methods.returnDescription: The port number.

methods.name: IsAddressValid
methods.description: Checks whether the component contains a valid IP address.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the component contains a valid IP address.

implementers.name: roSocketAddress
implementers.description: The roSocketAddress is used by the roStreamSocket and roDataGramSocket components for TCP and UDP traffic respectively

ifsocketasync.name: ifSocketAsync

methods.name: IsReadable
methods.description: Checks whether underlying select determines non-blocking read is possible.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether underlying select determines non-blocking read is possible.

methods.name: IsWritable
methods.description: Checks whether underlying select determines non-blocking write is possible.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether underlying select determines non-blocking write is possible.

methods.name: IsException
methods.description: Checks whether underlying select determines non-blocking read of OOB data is possible.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether underlying select determines non-blocking read of OOB data is possible.

methods.name: NotifyReadable

params.name: enable
params.description: A flag specifying whether roSocketEvent events are to be sent when the underlying socket becomes readable.

methods.description: Enables roSocketEvent events to be sent via the message port when the underlying socket becomes readable.

methods.name: NotifyWritable

params.name: enable
params.description: A flag specifying whether roSocketEvent events are to be sent when the underlying socket becomes writable.

methods.description: Enables roSocketEvent events to be sent via the message port when the underlying socket becomes writable.

methods.name: NotifyException

params.name: enable
params.description: A flag specifying whether roSocketEvent events are to be sent when the underlying socket gets an exception or OOB data.

methods.description: Enables roSocketEvent events to be sent via the message port when the underlying socket gets an exception or OOB data.

methods.name: GetID
methods.description: Returns a unique identifier that can be compared to the value returned by the [roSocketEvent.getSocketID()](https://developer.roku.com/docs/references/brightscript/events/rosocketevent.mdgetsocketid-as-integer) method to match the underlying socket to receive the event.

ifsocketasync.description: The ifSocketAsync interface provides asynchronous socket features that utilize a full-featured select loop in the Roku OS that communicates to the application using a BrightScript [roMessagePort](https://developer.roku.com/docs/references/brightscript/components/romessageport.md"roMessagePort"). This interface is valid on roStreamSocket and roDataGramSocket objects that were assigned a BrightScript port via SetMessagePort().

methods.name: GetBroadcast
methods.description: Checks whether broadcast messages may be sent or received.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether broadcast messages may be sent or received.

methods.name: SetBroadcast

params.name: enable
params.description: A flag specifying whether broadcast messages may be sent or received.

methods.description: Enables broadcast messages to be sent or received.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether this operation succeeded.

methods.name: JoinGroup

params.name: ipAddress
params.description: An [roSocketAddress](https://developer.roku.com/docs/references/brightscript/components/rostreamsocket.md"roSocketAddress") representing the group to be joined. IPV4 multicast addresses are in the range of 224.0.0.0 through 239.255.255.255.

methods.description: Joins a specific multicast group.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether this operation was successful.

methods.name: DropGroup

params.name: ipAddress
params.description: An [roSocketAddress](https://developer.roku.com/docs/references/brightscript/components/rostreamsocket.md"roSocketAddress") representing the group to leave. IPV4 multicast addresses are in the range of 224.0.0.0 through 239.255.255.255.

methods.description: Drops out of a specific multicast group.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether this operation was successful.

methods.name: GetMulticastLoop
methods.description: Checks whether multicast messages are enabled for local loopback.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether multicast messages are enabled for local loopback. If this flag is true, multicast message sent locally are to be received locally.

methods.name: SetMulticastLoop

params.name: enable
params.description: A flag specifying whether local loopback of multicast messages; otherwise do not send or receive broadcast messages.

methods.description: Enables local loopback of multicast messages.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether this operation was successful.

methods.name: GetMulticastTTL
methods.description: Returns the TTL integer value for multicast messages. This is the number of hops a packet is allowed before a router drops the packet.
methods.returnDescription: The multicast messages value.

methods.name: SetMulticastTTL

params.name: ttl
params.description: The number of hops a packet is allowed before a router drops the packet

methods.description: Sets the TTL integer value for multicast messages.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the TTL value was successfully set.

implementers.name: roDataGramSocket
implementers.description: The roDataGramSocket component enables Brightscript apps to send and receive UDP packets

methods.name: Listen

params.name: backlog
params.description: The limit for the queue of incoming connections

methods.description: Puts the socket into the listen state.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether listening can be done (generally, if bound address is valid).

methods.name: IsListening
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the [listen()](#listenbacklog-as-integer-as-boolean) method has been successfully called on this socket.

methods.name: Connect
methods.description: Establishes a connection.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether a socket connection has successfully been created. The connection might still not be complete if the socket is non-blocking

methods.name: Accept
methods.description: Accepts incoming requests.
methods.returnDescription: An roStreamSocket if the connection is pending; invalid otherwise. Use status to distinguish among success (eSuccess() or isConnected()), not ready (eOK()), and error.

methods.name: IsConnected
methods.description: Checks whether a [connect](#connect-as-boolean) or [accept](#accept-as-object) function has been completed on this socket.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether a connection has been established or accepted on this socket.

implementers.name: roStreamSocket
implementers.description: The roStreamSocket component enables BrightScript apps to accept and connect to TCP streams as well as send and receive data with them

methods.name: GetKeepAlive
methods.description: Checks whether keep alive is set. If keep alive is set, occasional no-data packets are sent to keep the connection alive.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether keep alive is set.

methods.name: SetKeepAlive

params.name: enable
params.description: A flag specifying whether keep alive is enabled.

methods.description: Sends no-data packets to keep the connection alive.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether keep alive was successfully set.

methods.name: GetLinger
methods.description: Returns the max time in seconds that the socket close() blocks to allow send data to be flushed in synchronous mode.
methods.returnDescription: The max time in seconds.

methods.name: SetLinger

params.name: time
params.description: The max time.

methods.description: Sets the max time in seconds that the socket close() blocks to allow send data to be flushed in synchronous mode.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the linger was successfully set.

methods.name: GetMaxSeg
methods.description: Returns the max TCP segment size.
methods.returnDescription: The segment size.

methods.name: SetMaxSeg

params.name: time
params.description: The max TCP segment size.

methods.description: Sets the max TCP segment size.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the max TCP segment size was successfully set.

methods.name: GetNoDelay
methods.description: Checks whether the no delay property is enabled on the socket. This means that data is sent as soon as it is available rather than once there is enough data to fill a segment.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the no delay property is enabled.

methods.name: SetNoDelay

params.name: enable
params.description: A flag specifying whether the no delay property is enabled.

methods.description: Enables the no delay property on the socket. This means that data is sent as soon as it is available rather than once there is enough data to fill a segment.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the no delay property was successfully set.

implementers.name: roStreamSocket
implementers.description: The roStreamSocket component enables BrightScript apps to accept and connect to TCP streams as well as send and receive data with them

methods.name: eIsConn

methods.name: eNotConn

methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether an ENOTCONN error has occurred.

implementers.description: The roStreamSocket component enables BrightScript apps to accept and connect to TCP streams as well as send and receive data with them

ifspringboardscreen.name: ifSpringboardScreen

methods.name: SetContent

params.name: content
params.description: A [content metadata](/docs/developer-program/getting-started/architecture/content-metadata.md " Content Meta-Data") object (an [roAssociativeArray](https://developer.roku.com/docs/references/brightscript/components/roassociativearray.md"roAssociativeArray")) describing the attributes for the title.

methods.description: Sets the content to be displayed on the Springboard Screen.

methods.name: SetDescriptionStyle

params.name: style
params.description: The screen style, which may be one of the following values:  *   "audio": All tags on audio screen above are substituted with content metadata. *   "movie": All tags on the video screen above are substituted with content metadata. *   "video": All tags except and are on the video screen above are replaced with content metadata. *   "generic": Only the and tags on the video screen above are replaced with content metadata.

methods.description: Description

methods.name: SetProgressIndicatorEnabled

params.name: enable
params.description: A flag specifying whether to display a progress indicator for audio content.

methods.description: Displays a progress indicator. This is only applicable if the content type is audio (ContentType == audio).

methods.name: SetProgressIndicator

params.name: progress
params.description: The amount of progress that has been completed.

params.name: max
params.description: The maximum size of the operation.

methods.description: Sets the progress indicator to be progress/max complete.

methods.name: AddButton

params.name: buttonID
params.description: The ID used to uniquely identify the button instance.

params.name: title
params.description: The title of the button.

methods.description: Adds a button to the screen. The buttons are displayed in a standard location on the screen and appear in the order added. When the button is pressed, the script will receive an event from the application containing the ID of the button pressed and allowing the script to perform the desired action for that case.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the button was successfully added.

methods.name: AddThumbsUpDownButton

params.name: buttonID
params.description: The ID used to uniquely identify the button instance.

params.name: thumbRating
params.description: The rating, which determines how the button appears on the screen. This may be one of the following values:  *   \-1 = thumbs down *   0 = no rating *   1 = thumbs up

methods.description: Adds a thumbs up/down button to the screen. This is a special type of button that is displayed in the standard location on the screen and appears in the order added sequenced with other buttons. When the button is pressed, the script will receive an event from the application indicating containing the ID of the button pressed and allowing the script to perform the desired action for that case.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the button was successfully added.

methods.name: AddThumbsUpDownButtonWithTips

params.name: buttonID
params.description: The ID used to uniquely identify the button instance.

params.name: thumbRating
params.description: The rating, which determines how the button appears on the screen. This may be one of the following values:  *   \-1 = thumbs down *   0 = no rating *   1 = thumbs up

params.name: tipText
params.description: An array of strings (size 2) which lets the script override the default tip text \["didn't like it", "liked it"\]

methods.description: Adds a thumbs up/down button with tip text to the screen. This is a special type of button that is displayed in the standard location on the screen and appears in the order added sequenced with other buttons. When the button is pressed, the script will receive an event from the application indicating containing the ID of the button pressed and allowing the script to perform the desired action for that case.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the button was successfully added.

params.name: buttonID
params.description: The ID used to uniquely identify the button instance.

params.name: userRating
params.description: A value between 1-100 that represents the number of stars that the user rated the content. A value of 1-20 corresponds to 1 star, 21-40 corresponds to 2 stars, etc.      The userRating takes precedence and determines the color of the buttons if set.

params.name: aggregateRating
params.description: The total average rating from all users. Half-stars maybe displayed for this rating.

methods.name: SetStaticRatingEnabled

params.name: enable
params.description: A flag specifying whether to display static rating stars.      Set this flag to false to use the ratings button or disable ratings on screen. This will remove this control from the screen. The extra space available will be used to display additional actors

methods.description: Sets the display of the static rating stars on or off.

methods.name: ClearButtons
methods.description: Clears all of the buttons from the screen and resets the array of buttons back to default with no buttons set.

params.name: location1
params.description: The text to be used for breadcrumb 1.

params.name: location2
params.description: The text to be used for breadcrumb 2.

methods.name: SetBreadcrumbEnabled

params.name: enable
params.description: A flag specifying whether to display the breadcrumb text.

methods.description: Shows or hides the breadcrumb text in the title area.

methods.name: PrefetchPoster

params.name: sdPosterURL
params.description: The URL of the standard definition poster image.

params.name: hdPosterURL
params.description: The URL of the high definition poster image.

methods.description: Allows the screen to pre-fetch the poster images before the screen is displayed as a display optimization technique. This is useful when doing left-right navigation between springboard screens. The pre-fetch is done, loading the image cache and then the screen is displayed.

methods.name: AllowUpdates

params.name: allow
params.description: A flag specifying whether to refresh the display.

methods.description: Refreshes the display. When adding multiple buttons to the springboard dynamically, you may want to defer screen updates temporarily to avoid flashing. For example, call AllowUpdates(false), add several buttons, and then call AllowUpdates(true) to refresh the display.

methods.name: AllowNavLeft

params.name: allow
params.description: True = Pressing LEFT sends an roSpringboardScreenEvent /isRemoteKeyPressed() event to the screen's message port.      False = Pressing LEFT plays a deadend sound.

methods.description: Enables navigating LEFT on the springboard screen (it is enabled by default).

methods.name: AllowNavRight

params.name: allow
params.description: True = Pressing RIGHT sends an roSpringboardScreenEvent /isRemoteKeyPressed() event to the screen's message port.      False = Pressing RIGHT plays a deadend sound.

methods.description: Enables navigating RIGHT on the springboard screen (it is enabled by default).

methods.name: AllowNavRewind

params.name: allow
params.description: True = Pressing REWIND sends an roSpringboardScreenEvent /isRemoteKeyPressed() event to the screen's message port.      False = Pressing REWIND plays a deadend sound.

methods.description: Enables the rewind remote event to be sent to the script (it is enabled by default).

methods.name: AllowNavFastForward

params.name: allow
params.description: True = Pressing FAST FORWARD sends an roSpringboardScreenEvent /isRemoteKeyPressed() event to the screen's message port.      False = Pressing FAST FORWARD plays a deadend sound.

methods.description: Enables the fast forward remote event to be sent to the script (it is enabled by default).

methods.name: SetPosterStyle

params.name: style
params.description: The display style, which enables the override of the screen type to one of the following values:  *   "rounded-square-generic": Artwork sizes: SD = 143x129; HD = 209x209 Note: is non-square NTSC pixel aspect ratio images. (Default) *   "rounded-rect-16x9-generic": 16x9 poster style. Artwork Sizes SD=177x90; HD=269x152 *   "multiple-portrait-generic": Artwork sizes: SD = 104x134 ; HD =142x202

methods.description: Sets the display style for the springboard screen. The default style is dependent on the content type of the poster.

methods.name: SetAdURL

params.name: sdAdURL
params.description: The URL of the standard definition banner ad image (540x60).

params.name: hdAdURL
params.description: The URL of the high definition banner ad image (728x90).

methods.description: Sets the URL of the banner ad image to be displayed on the springboard screen. This is currently only valid for the "video" style of springboard screen.

methods.name: SetAdSelectable

params.name: selectable
params.description: A flag specifying whether the banner ad is selectable.      True = The user can navigate and move focus to the banner image. When the banner ad is selected, the screen will receive an roPosterScreenEvent and the msg will return true for isAdSelected().      False = The banner ad is display-only (it is not selectable).

methods.description: Sets the banner ad to be selectable or display-only (by default, it is not selectable).

params.name: displayMode
params.description: The scale mode to be used, which may be one of the following values:  *   scale-to-fill: Scales image to completely fill the rectangle of the bounding frame (default) <br/ *   scale-to-fit: Scales image to fit horizontally or vertically as appropriate while still maintaining aspect ratio. This is the preferred display mode for ads.

methods.name: Show
methods.description: Displays or refreshes the screen after initial creation or state changes.
methods.returnDescription: A flag indicating whether the screen was refreshed.

methods.name: Close
methods.description: Closes the screen and deletes the associated object. This is useful for avoiding screen flicker when the display order of your screens does not resemble a stack.

methods.name: SetTitle

params.name: title
params.description: The title to be displayed on the screen.

methods.description: Sets the title for the screen.

methods.name: UseStableFocus
methods.description: Keeps the highlighted button the same on subsequent calls to Show() method. Typically, you will keep this setting disabled, which it is by default. This is because when navigating through springboards (using the left and right arrows), the user will want the top button to be highlighted.

methods.name: SetDisplayMode

params.name: displayMode
params.description: The display mode, which may be one of the following values:  *   "scale-to-fill": scales image to completely fill the rectangle of the bounding frame (default) *   "scale-to-fit": scales image to fit horizontally or vertically as appropriate while still maintaining aspect ratio. Note that scale-to-fit may result in pillar-box or letter-box display of images. *   "zoom-to-fill: scales and crops image to maintain aspect ratio and completely fill the rectangle of the bounding frame. *   photo-fit: uses several methods to fit the image with a different aspect ratio to the screen. First, it will asymmetrically scale up to a maximum of 5%. Second, for landscape images, if vertical cropping is necessary, it will remove two lines off the bottom for every one line off the top up to a maximum of 30% of the image. For all images, if horizontal cropping is necessary it will crop an equal amount from both sides.

methods.description: Sets the mode for displaying slideshow images. This allows images to be either scaled to completely fill the screen (scale-to-fill) or scaled to fit inside the screen (scale-to-fit) while maintaining aspect ratio.

implementers.name: roSpringboardScreen
implementers.description: The Springboard Screen shows detailed information about an individual piece of content and provides options for actions that may be taken on that content

This interface is deprecated.

Beginning July 1st, 2017, any new channels using this component will be rejected during certification.

Beginning January 1st, 2018, any updates to existing channels using this component will be rejected during certification.

methods.name: MoveTo

params.name: x
params.description: The x-coordinate to which the sprite is to be moved.

params.name: y
params.description: The y-coordinate to which the sprite is to be moved.

methods.description: Move the sprite to a new set of coordinates.

methods.name: MoveOffset

params.name: xOffset
params.description: The offset from the current x-coordinate to be used.

params.name: yOffset
params.description: The offset from the current y-coordinate to be used.

methods.description: Move the sprite to a new position based on offsets to the current position.

methods.name: GetX
methods.description: Returns the x-coordinate of the sprite.
methods.returnDescription: The x-coordinate of the sprite.

methods.name: GetY
methods.description: Returns the y-coordinate of the sprite.
methods.returnDescription: The y-coordinate of the sprite.

methods.name: SetZ

params.name: z
params.description: The z value to be used for the sprite.

methods.description: Sets the z value of the sprite. The z value defines the order in which sprites are drawn. Sprites with higher z values are drawn after (in front of) sprites with lower z values. The default z value is 0.

methods.name: GetZ
methods.description: Returns the z value of the sprite.
methods.returnDescription: The z value of the sprite.

methods.name: SetDrawableFlag

params.name: enable
params.description: A flag specifying whether the sprite is drawable:      True = The sprite is drawable.      False = The sprite may only be used for collision tests.

methods.description: Sets whether this sprite is drawable or just used for collision tests. An undrawable sprite can be used to define a region in the background that needs collision testing. It can also be used as an auxiliary collision region for a more complex sprite defined in another sprite.

methods.name: GetDrawableFlag
methods.description: Checks whether the sprite is drawable.

params.description: The bits to be set for determining which sprites to check for collisions. The default value is 1.

methods.description: Sets bits to determine which sprites will be checked for collisions. The sprites that are checked must have the corresponding bits sets in their MemberFlags.

methods.returnDescription: The value of the flag variable.

methods.name: GetRegion
methods.description: Returns an roRegion object that specifies the region of a bitmap that is the sprite's display graphic.
methods.returnDescription: roRegion object.

methods.description: Adjusts the part of an [roRegion](https://developer.roku.com/docs/references/brightscript/components/roregion.md"roRegion")'s bitmap that is being displayed as the sprite. Wrap is taken into consideration.

methods.name: SetData

params.name: data
params.description: The user-defined data to be associated with the sprite.

methods.description: Associates user-defined data with the sprite. The data can be any type including intrinsic types or objects.

methods.name: GetData
methods.description: Returns any user data associated with the sprite previously set via the [SetData()](#setdatadata-as-dynamic-as-void) method.
methods.returnDescription: Any user-defined data associated with the sprite. Returns invalid if there is no user data associated with this sprite.

methods.name: CheckCollision
methods.description: Returns the first [roSprite](https://developer.roku.com/docs/references/brightscript/components/rosprite.md"roSprite") that this sprite collides with.
methods.returnDescription: An roSprite object. If there are no collisions, this method returns invalid.

methods.name: CheckMultipleCollisions
methods.description: Returns an roArray of all roSprite objects this sprite collides sprites. The collision area is the entire sprite's bounding box, and the sprites must actually be overlapped to detect a collision. That is, if a fast moving sprite moves "through" another sprite without actually overlapping when this call is made, no collision is detected.
methods.returnDescription: roArray of colliding sprites. If there are no collisions, this method returns invalid.

methods.name: Remove
methods.description: Removes the sprite from the managing roComposite object and deletes the sprite.

implementers.description: This component is associated with a managing roCompositor object

params.name: delim
params.description: A set of characters which are treated as delimiters. A sequence of two or more contiguous delimiters in the string is treated as a single delimiter.

methods.description: Splits the string into separate substrings separated by a single delimiter character.
methods.returnDescription: An roList containing the each of the substrings. The delimiters are not returned.

methods.name: Split

params.name: separator
